Vučić: Primakov ostavio neizbrisiv trag u svetskoj politici

04 Nov 2019, 17:10





















Predsednik Srbije Aleksandar Vučić izjavio je danas u Beogradu da je bivši ruski premijer Jevgenij Primakov ostavio neizbrisiv trag u svetskoj politici i da su gradjani Srbije osetili važnost njegove borbe za pravdu i pravičnost.Na ceremoniji otkrivanja biste Primakovu u Ruskom domu, Vučić je rekao da je njegov "zaokret iznad Atlantika" 24. marta 1999. godine, kada je odustao od planirane posete Vašingtonu zbog početka bombardovanja Jugoslavije, mnogo značio za Srbiju."Njegov demarš 1999. godine, poznat kao zaokret iznad Atlantika, za Srbiju je mnogo značio, ali to je bio i potpuni zaokret u spoljnoj politici Rusije koji joj i danas omogućava da sačuva stabilnost uprkos brojnim izazovima", kazao je Vučić.On je naveo da snaga Rusije 1999. godine i danas nisu za poredjenje i ocenio da je politika Primakova bila dalekovida pošto je predvideo nastanak multipolarnog sveta."Mi u Srbiji iskreno cenimo sve što je uradio za Rusiju, ali i za naše pravo da postojimo i budemo svoji na svome", rekao je predsednik Srbije.Vučić je prisutnima čestitao Dan narodnog jedinstva koji Rusija danas slavi i poželeo da "večno živi prijateljstvo Rusije i Srbije".Ambasador Rusije u Beogradu Aleksandar Bocan-Harčenko rekao je da je Primakov bio velika ličnost i da protokom vremena dolazi do izražaja njegova "veličanstvenost i značaj" kao političara, diplomate, naučnika i humaniste."Jevgenij Primakov je imao sposobnost da gleda nekoliko decenija unapred, a njegov koncept multilateralizma danas je temelj medjunarodne politike", kazao je Bocan-Harčenko.On je naveo da je predsednik Rusije Vladimir Putin nazvao Primakova "velikim gradjaninom Rusije" i ocenio da "ništa više od toga ne treba reći".Bocan-Harčenko je rekao da je "imao sreću" da radi s Primakovom kad je on 1996. postao šef ruske diplomatije i dodao da je bio posvećen zaštiti nacionalnog interesa i da je vodio računa o saradnji sa Srbijom i snazi Rusije na Balkanu."Ponudio je više predloga za rešenje problema Kosova, ali se Zapad od početka pripremao za agresiju protiv Srbije", naveo je ruski ambasador.Bivši premijer Rusije Sergej Stepašin rekao je da je Primakov, s kojim je bio prijatelj, promenio smer spoljne politike Rusije 1996. godine i dodao da Moskva i danas sledi taj pravac.Naveo je i da je Primakov kao premijer spasio Rusiju od ekonomske katastrofe 1999. godine i da je učinio sve što je bilo u njegovoj moći da spreči bombardovanje tadašnje Jugoslavije.Direktorka Ruskog centra za nauku i kulturu "Ruski dom" u Beogradu Eleonora Mitrofanova rekla je da je odluka Primakova da otkaže posetu SAD 24. marta 1999. dok je bio u avionu iznad Atlantika "gest kojim je pokazao koliko mnogo je podržavao Srbiju i koliko je bio protiv bombardovanja suverene zemlje".Mitrofanova je dodala da je "taj čin označio i promenu smera spoljne politike Rusije".Bistu Primakovu otkrili su njegova udovica Irina Primakova i autor dela, ruski vajar Andrej Tirtišnikov.Primakov je bio premijer Rusije od septembra 1998. do maja 1999. godine, a prethodno je od januara 1996. bio šef diplomatije. Umro je u junu 2015. godine.

Vucic: Primakov left an indelible mark on world politics

04 Nov 2019, 16:10





















Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said in Belgrade today that former Russian Prime Minister Yevgeny Primakov left an indelible mark on world politics and that the citizens of Serbia felt the importance of his fight for justice and justice.In a ceremony to unveil Primakov in the Russian House, Vucic said that his "turn over the Atlantic" on March 24, 1999, when he gave up his planned visit to Washington because of the start of the bombing of Yugoslavia, meant a lot to Serbia. "His 1999 demarche, known as the Atlantic Turn, meant a lot to Serbia, but it was also a complete turn in Russia's foreign policy, which still allows it to maintain stability despite numerous challenges, "Vucic said. He said that Russia's forces in 1999 are still not in comparison and assessed that Primakov's policy was far-sighted since predicted the emergence of a multipolar world. "We in Serbia sincerely appreciate everything he has done for Russia, but also for our right to exist and to be Vucic congratulated those present on the Day of National Unity, which Russia is celebrating today and wished "a friendship between Russia and Serbia forever." Russian Ambassador to Belgrade Alexander Bocan-Kharchenko said that Primakov was a great personality and "The magnificence and significance" of politicians, diplomats, scientists and humanists is reflected in the passage of time. "Yevgeny Primakov has had the ability to look decades ahead, and his concept of multilateralism is today the cornerstone of international politics," Bocan-Harchenko said. He stated that Russian President Vladimir Putin called Primakov "a great citizen of Russia" and said that "nothing more needs to be said." Bocan-Kharchenko said he was "lucky" to work with Primakov when he became in 1996. the head of Russian diplomacy, adding that he was committed to protecting the national interest and that he took care of co-operation with Serbia and the strength of Russia in the Balkans. "He offered more proposals for re of the Kosovo problem, but the West has been preparing for aggression against Serbia from the beginning, "said the Russian ambassador. Former Russian Prime Minister Sergei Stepashin said that Primakov, with whom he was friends, changed Russia's foreign policy in 1996 and added that Moscow and today he follows that direction. He also stated that Primakov, as prime minister, had saved Russia from an economic catastrophe in 1999 and had done everything in his power to prevent the bombing of what was then Yugoslavia.Director of the Russian Center for Science and Culture "Russian House" in Belgrade, Eleonora Mitrofanova said Primakov's decision to cancel a visit to the United States on March 24, 1999 while on a plane over the Atlantic "was a gesture showing how much he supported Serbia and how much he was against the bombing of a sovereign country." Mitrofanova added that "This act also marked a change in the direction of Russia's foreign policy." Emir of Russia from September 1998 to May 1999, and previously since January 1996 he has been Chief of Diplomacy. He died in June 2015.
